pageContext.claim: “Already, as a result of my administration’s efforts, in 2018 drug prices experienced their single largest decline in 46 years.”
pageContext.analysis: The consumer price index for prescription drugs fell by 0.6 percent for the 12 months ending in December, according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics. The decline is the first time in 46 years in the December-to-December time frame, but there have been other 12-month periods with index declines, mostly recently in 2013.
